item.title: 3D hidden object game Sniper Dan announced for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Fix problems with a sniper rifle.

Publisher PQube and developer Denki have announced family-friendly 3D hidden object game Sniper Dan for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC (Steam). A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via PQube:

About

Meet Dan. Dan has a sniper rifle. Don’t panic, he’s not here to harm anyone. Dan’s a professional and his job is fixing things. From a distance. With pinpoint accuracy and good intentions.

Sniper Dan is a hidden object game unlike any other. Objects aren’t always well hidden and the solution involves shooting them. Each job follows a simple and highly respected method.

  1. Figure out the problem. Use the clues. HMM…
  2. Find the problem. Scope the area. AHA!
  3. Fix the problem. Shoot. WHEE!

You’re not hunting enemies. You’re hunting problems. Fixing rusty taps, machines behaving badly, and even stop a thieving Pelican. Travel far and wide across lively 3D locations packed with visual jokes and silly situations as you help those in need. Can Dan and his trusty tool get the job done?

Dan’s business takes him to villages, parks, farms, airports, cities, and beyond. Special challenges keep every day fresh. Take on optional work for extra cash, tackle bigger jobs for even bigger rewards, and uncover secrets that leave citizens quietly convinced something magical just happened.

It did. It was Dan!

Between contracts, upgrade your rifle, decorate your office hub, and grow your entirely legitimate troubleshooting business. Unlock bonus games and extra modes like Time Attack, Ammo Hunt, and Photo Mode, all under the judgmental eye of Rank Chook.

Funny, colorful, and sure to leave you wanting more, Sniper Dan is about finding what’s wrong, fixing it fast, and moving on to the next job.

Scope the problem. Take the shot. Make everyone happy.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Code Vein II debuts at 14,452 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of January 26, 2026 to February 1, 2026.

Code Vein II for PlayStation 5 was the highest selling new release of the week at 14,452 retail copies sold. It was the only new game release to chart in the top 10.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 69,586 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 10,949 units, the Switch family sold 10.678 units, the Xbox Series family sold 525 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 13 units.

item.title: Crimson Desert ‘Features Overview #2: Combat and Progression’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Learn what it means to fight like a Greymane.

Pearl Abyss has released a new featurette for open-world action adventure game Crimson Desert introducing the game’s combat and progression.

“In the second Features Overview video, learn what it means to fight like a Greymane,” the video description reads. “From weapons to chaining skills, we look at how combat works in Crimson Desert. This episode will also cover how you’ll unlock skills, upgrade equipment, face the threats of Pywel, and grow into a formidable fighter.”

Crimson Desert is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on March 19.
